Title: Court dismisses Wasiu Ayinde’s application to stop selection of next Awujale
Summary: Fuji Musician, Wasiu Olasunkanmi Ayinde, filed an application to stop selection of next Awujale . An Ogun State High Court sitting Ijebu-Ode, dismissed the application .

Title: Amusan decries chaos, unchecked access at Nigerian airports
Summary: Former President of the National Association of Nigerian Travel Agencies (NANTA), Olusoji Amusan, has raised concern over what he described as 'chaos' in Nigeria's airports . He decries chaos, unchecked access at Nigerian airports .

Title: Osimhen declares self fit for battle against Tanzania
Summary: Super Eagles striker Victor Osimhen says he is fully fit and ready to lead Nigeria’s charge at the Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON), beginning on January 17 . Super Eagles take on Tanzania in their opening game of the tournament .

Title: The Guardian, Onyenucheya clinch best maritime media, journalist award
Summary: The Merchant Seafarers Association of Nigeria and USA (Merchant Navy – Sail Navy) has honoured The Guardian and its maritime reporter, Adaku Onyenucheya .

Title: U.S. conducts surveillance flights over Nigeria after Trump threats
Summary: The United States has been carrying out intelligence-gathering flights over large parts of Nigeria since late November . The U.S. conducts surveillance flights over Nigeria after Trump threats .

Title: Dollar to Naira exchange rate today, December 23, 2025
Summary: The Nigerian Naira maintained a relatively stable position against the United States Dollar on Tuesday, December 23, 2025 . Trading opened across both the official and parallel markets .

Title: Nigeria leads as Africa’s instant payment transactions hit $2tn — SIIPS
Summary: Nigeria has emerged as a continental leader in Africa’s fast-growing digital payments ecosystem . Instant payment systems across the continent processed transactions worth nearly $2 trillion in 2024, according to a new report . The State of Inclusive Instant Payment Systems, SIIPS, 2025 Report, released by the AfricaNenda Foundation .

Title: New tax implementation to reduce compliance burdens —RMAFC Boss
Summary: The implementation of new tax laws, starting January 1, 2026, will reduce the burden of compliance . Dr. Mohammed Shehu made the remark at the National Stakeholders’ Discourse themed “Enhancing Fiscal Efficiency and Fiscal Efficiency’

Title: Petrol supply rises 55% to 71.5m litres daily
Summary: The supply of Premium Motor Spirit (PMS), also known as petrol, increased to 71.5m litres per day in November 2025 from 46m litres in October . The Nigerian Midstream and Downstream Petroleum Regulatory Authority (NMDPRA) said the volume of petrol has increased 55 per cent . •As consumption hits 52.1
